alert.note: Alert for Clark; Hot Spring (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 29 at 10:50AM CDT until May 01 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Little Rock AR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Arkansas... Ouachita River At Arkadelphia affecting Clark and Hot Spring Counties. Ouachita River At Camden affecting Ouachita and Calhoun Counties. Ouachita River At Thatcher L&D affecting Union, Calhoun and Bradley Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING TO MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ouachita River At Arkadelphia. * WHEN...From Sunday morning to Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Farmland along the river begins to flood. Water over State Highway 7 and 51 at railroad underpass. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to flood stage Sunday morning to a crest of 17.0 feet. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 1 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Crest Time Date Ouachita River Arkadelphia 17.0 10.9 Sat 9 AM 17.0 10.8 7.9 17.0 7 AM 4/30 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
